climbs.name: Booze Me Up It Takes Gear

content.description: Start below the triangle roof and move up strait and slightly right. The gully to the right is a different climb, and if you use it and or the right arete the climb is 5.10ish. The climb is sustained through out the middle section and takes small wires to .75 cams. Nice and challenging discontinuous crack system that is heady till the end moves. PG13 but there is gear just be mindful.
content.protection: Small wires to .75 or 1. Boulder and tree at top for anchor. descent is to the right of blarney stone and is 4th class.
content.location: Located right at the top of the gully approach, under a triangular roof... notice the left of the roof is the top rope arete and blarney stone.

climbs.name: The Blarney Stone
climbs.fa: FKA Gavin Bridgeman, Shawn Curtis, Alex Grant

content.description: Just one lil' cruxy move past the chalk stone aka blarney stone. Really fun movement but short. On good stone but still needs some traffic to clean it up, that being said it much cleaner than it was. Good warm up for other areas and fun lil' gear lead.
content.protection: Gear green alien (.1) to #3 black diamond.  Anchor is large boulder that requires padding and a short static rope, there is also a small tree but you should back this up. 4 class walk off to the left of climb.
content.location: The route is on the other side of the approach gully. Hike up the gully and you will reach the crag. 4th class walk off next to Blarney stone or 3 class off to malaria crag.
